qas.question: What public area in New Haven is home to free concerts in the summer?
What musical festival was initiated in 1982 in New Haven?
In what year was the New Haven Jazz Festival cancelled, thereby precluding it from being one of the longest running free outdoor festivals in the U.S.?
Who sponsors the New Haven Jazz Festival?
What is the name for the concerts held on New Haven Green throughout the month of July?
What popular events that place in New Haven Green area?
When did the first Jazz Festival made it debut?
In general how many people attend these music concerts?
After being cancel in 2007, what organization currently support New Haven Jazz Festival?

context: The <a0_0>New Haven Green<a0_0/> is the site of many <a5_0>free music concerts<a5_0/>, especially during the summer months. These have included the New Haven Symphony Orchestra, the <a4_0>July Free Concerts<a4_0/> on the Green in July, and the <a1_0>New Haven Jazz Festival<a1_0/> in August. The Jazz Festival, which began in <a6_0>1982<a6_0/>, is one of the longest-running free outdoor festivals in the U.S., until it was canceled for <a2_0>2007<a2_0/>. Headliners such as The Breakfast, Dave Brubeck, Ray Charles and Celia Cruz have historically drawn <a7_0>30,000 to 50,000 fans<a7_0/>, filling up the New Haven Green to capacity. The New Haven Jazz Festival was revived in 2008 and has been sponsored since by <a3_0><a8_0>Jazz Haven<a8_0/><a3_0/>.
